about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must:

about.name: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must:

hasPart.assesses: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must: | If a traffic signal light is not working, you must: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If a traffic signal is not working and no lights are showing, you should proceed cautiously as if the intersection is controlled by stop signs in all directions.

comment.text: Stop, then proceed when safe.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop before entering the intersection and let all other traffic go first.

comment.text: Stop before entering the intersection and let all other traffic go first.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down or stop, only if necessary.

comment.text: Slow down or stop, only if necessary.
Stop, then proceed when safe.

answerExplanation.text: If a traffic signal is not working and no lights are showing, you should proceed cautiously as if the intersection is controlled by stop signs in all directions.

comment.text: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must: | If a traffic signal is not working and no lights are showing, you should proceed cautiously as if the intersection is controlled by stop signs in all directions.

hasPart.name: If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane:

about.name: If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane:

hasPart.assesses: If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane: | If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian with a guide dog or a white cane.

suggestedAnswer.text: The pedestrian must yield the right-of-way.

comment.text: The pedestrian must yield the right-of-way.
You must yield the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Honk your horn to let them know you are there.

comment.text: Honk your horn to let them know you are there.
You must yield the right-of-way.

answerExplanation.text: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian with a guide dog or a white cane.

comment.text: If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane: | Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian with a guide dog or a white cane.

hasPart.name: You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red:

about.name: You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red:

hasPart.assesses: You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red: | You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Even if the signal is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

comment.text: Under any circumstances.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a yellow light.

comment.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a yellow light.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

comment.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
Under any circumstances.

answerExplanation.text: Even if the signal is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

comment.text: You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red: | Even if the signal is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

hasPart.name: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the:

about.name: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the:

hasPart.assesses: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the: | To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three-Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

comment.text: One-second rule.
Two-second rule.
Three-second rule.
Three-second rule.

answerExplanation.text: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three-Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

comment.text: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the: | Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three-Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

hasPart.name: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones?

about.name: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones? | Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving in a work zone, adjust your speed for the traffic conditions and don't follow other vehicles too closely. Be attentive to workers and machines in the work zone.

comment.text: Tailgating another vehicle

suggestedAnswer.text: Failing to carefully watch for workers and moving equipment

comment.text: Failing to carefully watch for workers and moving equipment
Both of the above
Both of the above

answerExplanation.text: When driving in a work zone, adjust your speed for the traffic conditions and don't follow other vehicles too closely. Be attentive to workers and machines in the work zone.

comment.text: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones? | When driving in a work zone, adjust your speed for the traffic conditions and don't follow other vehicles too closely. Be attentive to workers and machines in the work zone.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: You see a signal person at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions:

about.name: You see a signal person at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions:

hasPart.assesses: You see a signal person at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions: | You see a signal person at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Obey special signs or instructions from flaggers. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only if you see orange cones on the road ahead.

comment.text: Only if you see orange cones on the road ahead.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless they conflict with existing signs, signals, or laws.

comment.text: Unless they conflict with existing signs, signals, or laws.
At all times.
At all times.

answerExplanation.text: Obey special signs or instructions from flaggers. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

comment.text: You see a signal person at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions: | Obey special signs or instructions from flaggers. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.
